intro: Scorzoneroides pyrenaica var. helvetica, commonly known as the Pyrenean helvetica scorzoneroid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky or gravelly soils. It is native to the Pyrenees and surrounding mountain ranges in Europe. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
